channel.title: Blade of Deth (updated)
channel.description:
This is my first item period, lemme hear what you think.
UPDATED: Added Color, Remade
How's this? I went through and remade the whole thing, implemented it into a server and everything. (bottom sword is a quick donor sword I made for the server) [IMG]http://i296.photobucket.com/albums/mm168/dethscall/Customs.png[/img] [IMG]http://i296.photobucket.com/albums/mm168/dethscall/BladeofDeth4-1.png[/img]

item.title: Blade of Deth (updated)
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

[quote=“LordDeth, post:9, topic:398429”][quote author=Ix Soulcist xI link=topic=495565.msg3623761#msg3623761 date=1307657543]
It’s alright, decent for a first.
[/quote]

Well, I hate to be conceited but this is the only “first time project” on here that doesn’t look like a shitty dildo or toilet paper dispenser, not to mention its also better than most items a lot of the seasoned developers have been submitting on here. You’re statement is kinda offensive, but thank you for acknowledging my work I suppose.[/quote]
Stopped here a long time ago from people with attitude like that. Unappreciative, too high of confidence, and lack of respect.

@Topic - Try to clean up the wire-frame a little. The less poly you have, the easier something can be to animate, as well as the fact, there is less strain on the CPU when rotating, etc. Along with higher grades if you pursue this as a college major. The last model I did a while back was around 400 total faces (lost the HDD with this on it, so i grabbed the pic from facebook). As mentioned, try re-doing this in a cleaner form. It may look nice now, but down the road (if you continue) you will look back and think to yourself “the hell?”

Read full topic

I’d like a few tips on starting my own models if you’d be nice enough to give me your time.

Off topic: You misspelled Death :P[/quote]
Err, he’s modeling wrong. Try the link in my sig, it’ll get you started.
Also, considering his name is LordDeth, the sword is probably named after him, respectively.

item.title: Blade of Deth (updated)
item.dc:creator: @the_wanderer The Wanderer
item.description:
@the_wanderer wrote:

Holy shit. He achieved polygonal flow with tracing. Now if only this was in quads. I advise you to use primitives to speed up the modeling process. If you want to stick with tracing search the word advanced and a tutorial by me will pop up. I would link you it but I’m on my iPod. I would advise you to recreate this blade using primitives. And be less cocky. if you know your better than some people then you really shouldn’t have to point it out. And also remember that the better a model is, and the more effort there is put into it, the more criticism you will receive (generally).

Read full topic

item.title: Blade of Deth (updated)
item.dc:creator: @Java_Is_My_Bitch2 Java Is My Bitch
item.description:
@Java_Is_My_Bitch2 wrote:

For one, the overall model is a normal start, all the shitty models you see are from beginners who don’t have much interest in modelling and quit after 2-8 models. The wireframe is horrendous and inconsistent. Looks like you used the trace method which won’t get you beyond doing shitty, flat models.

Read full topic

item.title: Blade of Deth (updated)
item.dc:creator: @amy_webb1 amy_webb
item.description:
@amy_webb1 wrote:

Sorry to burst your buuble sir, but its flat. Too flat, your handle shouldn’t be like that. You blade is too thick, make it alittle thinner. You can see white faces on the model, so you might want to fix them up. Also the handle is a polly overkill, good try though. Try again and you’ll see.

Read full topic

item.title: Blade of Deth (updated)

item.description:

[quote=“LordDeth, post:9, topic:398429”][quote author=Ix Soulcist xI link=topic=495565.msg3623761#msg3623761 date=1307657543]
It’s alright, decent for a first.
[/quote]

Well, I hate to be conceited but this is the only “first time project” on here that doesn’t look like a shitty dildo or toilet paper dispenser, not to mention its also better than most items a lot of the seasoned developers have been submitting on here. You’re statement is kinda offensive, but thank you for acknowledging my work I suppose.[/quote]
He gave you a nice review on your first model (which rarely ever happens in this section) and you feel the need to claim your better then all the beginner’s? You didn’t show us something godly, you showed a scimitar, don’t be so cocky.

Read full topic

item.title: Blade of Deth (updated)
item.dc:creator: @LordDeth LordDeth
item.description:
@LordDeth wrote:

Thanks for the constructive criticism, I understand there wasn’t much need for this many polys but once I already had it going and figured out to do the rest I couldn’t care less if there was a lot of polys, it looks the way I wanted it to, I’m proud of it.

Read full topic

item.title: Blade of Deth (updated)
item.dc:creator: @reyx7 reyx7
item.description:
@reyx7 wrote:

Ergg… the wireframe is a mess.
Take what you learned from doing this model, then click my sig and go for a cleaner wireframe.

You won’t receive good comments on future models unless you touch up that wireframe.

Read full topic

item.title: Blade of Deth (updated)
item.dc:creator: @rip4d rip4d
item.description:
@rip4d wrote:

Well it certainly looks nice, and it appears nicer than what some “seasoned developers” put out, but the reality is, it isn’t.

First of all, there are waaaaay too many polygons in that. The wireframe is a horrid mess, and needs some cleaning up to be done. To achieve those curves in the blade, that many points and edges are completely unnecessary. You can do so with far less. Also, there is no need for so many points in the handle, hilt and pummel of the blades for the same reason. Another thing, the points only look extruded, nothing more. If you held that, you’d cut your hands open. Its like a papercraft. Improve on these points, and maybe the model itself, not just the basic appearance will look well.

But as I said, its very good for a first model. Most beginners wouldn’t even have to patience to use so many points and try to replicate such detail.

Read full topic
